distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for rubygem-websocket-extensions fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-7663: Fixed an excessive resource consumption when parsing
  crafted message headers sent by an attacker (bsc#1172445).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: websocket-extensions ruby module prior to 0.1.5 allows Denial of Service (DoS) via Regex Backtracking. The extension parser may take quadratic time when parsing a header containing an unclosed string parameter value whose content is a repeating two-byte sequence of a backslash and some other character. This could be abused by an attacker to conduct Regex Denial Of Service (ReDoS) on a single-threaded server by providing a malicious payload with the Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header.
notes.title: CVE description
